interestingFact: Australia is the only country that is also a continent.
Brazil is home to the Amazon rainforest, the largest tropical rainforest in the world.
Canada has the longest coastline of any country in the world.
Japan is made up of over 6,800 islands.
India is the birthplace of four major world religions.
The Eiffel Tower in Paris was originally intended to be a temporary structure.
Germany is the home of the world’s first printed book.
South Africa has three capital cities, which is unique.
Mexico is home to the world’s largest pyramid, the Great Pyramid of Cholula.
The United Kingdom is made up of four countries: England, Scotland, Wales, and Northern Ireland.
Italy is home to the world’s first university, the University of Bologna, established in 1088.
Egypt is home to the ancient pyramids, some of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
